title: robelneo
author: robelneo
content: This happened 6 days ago and on two successive nights I dreamed that I was playing in a casino, I thought I'm spending too much time playing dice games at our fiesta, which usually starts at sunset and finishes before sunrise this is a record for me, it happens when I stopped playing because of the long hours.I thought it was alarming but doing research online I found out that there's nothing to worry about it's just a relapse dream, it happens when you are trying to shut one habit in this case gambling too much.How about you have you experienced dreaming that you are playing in a casino, is this alarming to you? Resource :https://gamblershelp.com.au/lets-talk-gambling/gambling-dreams/

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: If you are around your friends too much, you can dream about it. If you play a game without no money on your phone or laptop too much, you can dream about it. You can dream about what you are seeing very well around you. If you gamble, you can think about it and also dream about it at anytime. You may even think you won huge amount of money but woke up to nothing

comments.author: topbitcoin
comments.body: Playing in land casinos is a dream for some gamblers who often do it online because land casino gambling provides a very different sensation and adrenaline when we gamble online and even those who have played in land casinos always long to return there. So that these things become mere wishful thinking which can cause these wishful thinking to be carried away into dreams.But it's good if we decide to go to a land casino, then we have to improve the quality of our playing by continuing to hone our skills and deepen the tricks to get the win first. Because most of those who join land casinos are those who are experts and have qualified skills in gambling. Don't let us go to a land casino just to spend money and become a bad experience in gambling.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: I usually dream about things I give so much attention to. I once dreamt about winning big and the scream of my celebration woke up some people in the house from sleep. When I told the dream to some people, they said it is a good dream which means that I will soon win big. Since then I have not had any big wins. I love spots bettings and I am always active and passionate when my teams are playing. Sometimes I see a dream about gaming because of the attention I give to betting that period. I don't take dreams seriously because they are nothing but products of our imagination or daily activities. So I am not concerned about them because it is not a sign of any gambling disorder. This is because I strictly follow my gambling plans.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Well this may not happen to everyone regarding player casino in the dream, we all have what we all love to play, I love sport betting more than casino although I don't have any issues with playing casino.Yes I have many times dreamt about playing/stacking a sport match in the dream and winning big especially when I am anticipating the game ahead, some times I get lucky numbers or odds in the dreams and I go ahead to play it but never for once has it been profitable. I believe if we also have other things on our mind or we find away to clear our mind then this occurrence would be less.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: I do have a similar experience but in my dream, I have been playing chess. Seem an addiction at one point that even when I'm walking on the mall, the tiles I see on the patio are black and white chess board and I often hop like a knight. No shit    I'm not worried since I'm not losing money but during that time I think I'm losing my mind. Dreaming of gambling I guess is somewhat the same as addiction in my opinion. You are unconsciously showing what you wanted to do with your time and its manifested in your dreams.

comments.author: stomachgrowls
comments.body: Dreams could really be random on whatever kind of thing it is but it cant really be avoided that if you are dealing up with something on that particular day will be possibly the things that you would dream later on speciallyif the involvement itself is really that too long hours on which your brain might really be able to flash out those activity on the time that you do sleep, but in overall this doesnt have connection on whateverthings that you might experience in real world. Therefore, there's no point on minding that much about your dreams because it  doesnt really mean something, there are really just those people who are really thatmindful on dreams meaning on the time that they would really be able to dream it out on multiple times whether twice or thrice on which i couldn't really blame on.Even myself would definitely be seeking out some potential meaning if thats the case because its unusual for dreams to reoccur or would happen again and again.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on August 16, 2023, 07:32:30 PMThis happened 6 days ago and on two successive nights I dreamed that I was playing in a casino, I thought I'm spending too much time playing dice games at our fiesta, which usually starts at sunset and finishes before sunrise this is a record for me, it happens when I stopped playing because of the long hours.I thought it was alarming but doing research online I found out that there's nothing to worry about it's just a relapse dream, it happens when you are trying to shut one habit in this case gambling too much.How about you have you experienced dreaming that you are playing in a casino, is this alarming to you? Resource :https://gamblershelp.com.au/lets-talk-gambling/gambling-dreams/I'm surprised there's such a "specific" answer for it. Does that mean that any other dream I have, say about a certain game, means that I'm trying to shut it down? Honestly sounds really far-fetched to me. And while I do dream even if rarely, it's never in an instance where I was really bothered by it in the long run, heck I often forget about them after a few hours so I guess you remembering about it does have some sense of meaning. Well, I reckon anyone playing for almost idk, 12-13 hours maybe? would experience the same thing. I don't really think it's saying to shut down gambling, I think it's just telling you to take a break.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on August 16, 2023, 07:32:30 PMHow about you have you experienced dreaming that you are playing in a casino, is this alarming to you? I will consider it an indication of being too exposed to gambling if I have dreams of me gambling. It will be alarming when it becomes a common occurrence and I will take it as a pointer to reduce my relationship with people who always talk about gambling, reduce or temporarily pause gambling and steer clear of any triggers to such dreams. If you are not a gambler and you are having dreams of you gambling, if you allow these dreams to continue you will start gambling soon.If you are a gambler and you are having dreams of gambling, if you allow these dreams to continue, you will soon become an addict.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: It don't happen to me but I think that when we dream, it's because that we keep on thinking about that activity. So, if there have been dreams of you that are in a casino and casually gambling there.That means that it's like one of the things that you've thought of for so many times. But on me, despite that I've thought of it, it didn't come to any of my dream.Maybe it does because there's also a study that majority of our dreams are already forgotten when we wake up.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: It's just a dream and doesn't really affect our everyday choices. Loads of people have tried to read all sorts of stuff into dreams, but none of them are true. Dreams are just our brain doing its thing while we sleep. Sometimes it's just tossing around random thoughts, feelings, and memories that we picked up while awake. They don't hold deep significance or foresee the future.

That’s just normal for those who have been very excited to experience their first gambling in a casino and I’d say it’s never something that we should worry about. Gambling is a form of entertainment as what it’s designed, but in most cases we do gambling to chase bigger profits that are hard to experience when we only play at fiestas little casinos.

It is no question that a gambler will dream of playing in a casino. Especially when you're wanting to visit a physical casino anytime soon.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.created_time: August 16, 2023, 10:23:32 PMLast edit: August 16, 2023, 10:39:39 PM by acroman08
comments.body: one problem I see about it is that when a person misinterprets the dream, especially those who are superstitious, it can motivate them to gamble more thinking that their dream is a "sign", on top of that I've heard and seen people say they have dreamt about winning in gambling and ends up actually winning, it doesn't matter how much they won, for them as long as they won they think that their dream was a sign and fulfilled which just deepen their beliefs about dreaming about gambling.anyway, just to be clear, I agree with you that it happens when you are doing it or thinking about it too much. I've had my fair share of dreaming that I gamble, and I also have realised that it happens when I think too much about it.

comments.author: DoublerHunter
comments.body: Quote from: decodx on August 16, 2023, 09:03:48 PMIt's just a dream and doesn't really affect our everyday choices. Loads of people have tried to read all sorts of stuff into dreams, but none of them are true. Dreams are just our brain doing its thing while we sleep. Sometimes it's just tossing around random thoughts, feelings, and memories that we picked up while awake. They don't hold deep significance or foresee the future.^This is definitely right, that is just a dream.Every interesting activity that we have done will probably become our dream when we sleep and we give them a meaning but the fact is they are essentially the product of our brain's activity during sleep. Because for me, dreams can be a mixture of random thoughts, emotions, and memories that our brain processes while we sleep. They don't necessarily hold a profound or prophetic meaning, and they certainly don't predict the future. Instead, they are like a mental playground where our minds explore, process, and play with the information they have gathered while we are awake, nothing else.

comments.author: lionheart78
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on August 16, 2023, 07:32:30 PMThis happened 6 days ago and on two successive nights I dreamed that I was playing in a casino, I thought I'm spending too much time playing dice games at our fiesta, which usually starts at sunset and finishes before sunrise this is a record for me, it happens when I stopped playing because of the long hours.I thought it was alarming but doing research online I found out that there's nothing to worry about it's just a relapse dream, it happens when you are trying to shut one habit in this case gambling too much.It looks like you had so much fun on that night time gambling in your place that your subconscious wanted to recreate it in its own world .  I think to have a dream one doesn't have to think of it too hard, it just the dream appears all of a sudden, a collection of your fun, frustrations, and fears.Quote from: robelneo on August 16, 2023, 07:32:30 PMHow about you have you experienced dreaming that you are playing in a casino, is this alarming to you? I have dreamt that I am in a gambling environment playing cards and betting huge amounts of money against the bank, but it does not bring much alarm to me because I believe that it was just a dream and it is far from reality.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on August 16, 2023, 07:32:30 PMHow about you have you experienced dreaming that you are playing in a casino, is this alarming to you? It might be as a result of the discussion you have been engaging with cause the brain works like that sometimes after a long day when we retire to bed when tend to dream about the things that happened to us during the day or that we did the most during that week.I have dreamt about being in a casino and spending some some money and at the end I always win I don’t think there have been a time I have ever lost or did something bad in my dream, and because of that I mostly take it with a grain of salt. Some could think that dreaming about a casino could have some kind of a latent impact but to me I feel they’re are just as a result of what we have experienced.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: I've only experienced it once, but mine was in an online casino because I used to play slots and other casino games frequently during that time. I wouldn't mind having a dream like that again because I remember winning something big in that dream.  I'm not that concerned if I get these dreams multiple times because I already have rules and limitations for my gambling activities and i'm aware if i'm going too far.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Haven't really had this dream, ever, but I agree that if you’re trying to break a habit that you’ve been doing for too long, you’ll really get this kind of relapses and sudden thoughts about that exact same habit. I guess you really need to take a step back or get a new habit that is less destructive - or as much as possible, non-destructive - for you to move forward and leave gambling for good. It's a really hard thing to do, but I guess it's doable with proper support and determination to get out of the cycle.
